# CXSetGroupCallAction

**Class**

An encapsulation of the act of grouping or ungrouping calls.

## Declaration

```swift
class CXSetGroupCallAction
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXSetGroupCallAction] is a concrete subclass of [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallAction]. When the user or the system groups a call with another call, the provider sends [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXProviderDelegate/provider(_:perform:)-9masw] to its delegate. The provider’s delegate calls the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXAction/fulfill()] method to indicate that the action was successfully performed. A group call allows more than two recipients to simultaneously communicate with one another.

## Creating New Actions

- **init(call:callUUIDToGroupWith:)**: Initializes a new action for a call identified by a given UUID, as well as a call to group with identified by another UUID.
- **init(coder:)**: Creates a new action to group calls with data in an unarchiver.

## Accessing Action Attributes

- **callUUIDToGroupWith**: The unique identifier of the call to be grouped with the call associated with the receiver.

## Call-related actions

- **CXAction**: An abstract class that declares a programmatic interface for objects that represent a telephony action.
- **CXCallAction**: A programmatic interface for objects that represent a telephony action associated with a call object.
- **CXEndCallAction**: An encapsulation of the act of ending a call.
- **CXPlayDTMFCallAction**: An encapsulation of the act of playing a dual tone multifrequency (DTMF) sequence.
- **CXSetHeldCallAction**: An encapsulation of the act of placing a call on hold or removing a call from hold.
- **CXSetMutedCallAction**: An encapsulation of the act of muting or unmuting a call.
- **CXSetTranslatingCallAction**: An encapsulation of the act of translating a call.

## Inherits From

- CXCallAction

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
